text: a sea of red flags in Istanbul Turkish
people gathered in an unprecedented show
of support for their country and their
president wretched tire Bedouins after
the coup attempt to the 15th of july he
now appears stronger than ever
similar rallies were held across the
country the president said he would take
action against those behind the coup
possibly reintroducing the death penalty
they say there is no death penalty in
the EU or the council or here or there
well the US has it
Japan has it China has it most of the
world has it so they are allowed to have
it we used to have it until 1984
sovereignty belongs to the people so if
the people make this decision I'm sure
the political parties will comply for
his supporters this was a moment of
triumph after the chaos and fear of the
night of the failed uprising Turks are
determined to our democracy there are
god knows how many people are here and
they are from different political views
different religions and all are here to
show that despite all our differences we
want to live in solidarity upholding
democracy but it wasn't just followers a
president everyone who joined in the
rallies the opposition took part - over
the Kurdish party wasn't invited who can
be lean about the world is seeing the
Turkish people here today regardless of
which party they support they are seeing
how successful and determined - Turkish
people are how loyal they are to their
country
protesters demanding the death penalty
for the man accused of masterminding the
coup the us-based Muslim cleric fatale
of Gulen he denies the charges tens of
thousands of teachers judges and
military officers have been dismissed or
arrested since the uprising president
Erewhon
has been accused of taking the clamp
down too far people are gathering here
with their friends with their children
in a mass display of solidarity the coup
attempt deeply unsettled people here
there are some parts of Turkish society
which are concerned about the extent of
mr. elder ones purges but the people
here are celebrating their victory over
the coup the scale of these
demonstrations sends a powerful message
in a time of uncertainty many Turks are
rallying around their leader
Bethenny Bell BBC News Istanbul
